item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Man only likes to count his troubles; he doesn't calculate his happiness." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Above all, don't lie to yourself. The man who lies to himself and listens to his own lie comes to a point that he cannot distinguish the truth within him, or around him, and so loses all respect for himself and for others. And having no respect he ceases to love." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "To go wrong in one's own way is better then to go right in someone else's." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Right or wrong, it's very pleasant to break something from time to time." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Nothing in this world is harder than speaking the truth, nothing easier than flattery." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "You can be sincere and still be stupid." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoyevsky
item.description: "To love someone means to see them as God intended them." -- Fyodor Dostoyevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "It is not the brains that matter most, but that which guides them â€” the character, the heart, generous qualities, progressive ideas." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Much unhappiness has come into the world because of bewilderment and things left unsaid." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "The cleverest of all, in my opinion, is the man who calls himself a fool at least once a month." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Without God all things are permitted." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoyevsky
item.description: "We sometimes encounter people, even perfect strangers, who begin to interest us at first sight, somehow suddenly, all at once, before a word has been spoken." -- Fyodor Dostoyevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "I swear to you gentlemen, that to be overly conscious is a sickness, a real, thorough sickness." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "The soul is healed by being with children." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "If you wish to glimpse inside a human soul and get to know a man, don't bother analyzing his ways of being silent, of talking, of weeping, of seeing how much he is moved by noble ideas; you will get better results if you just watch him laugh. If he laughs well, he's a good man." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Taking a new step, uttering a new word, is what people fear most." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "My God, a moment of bliss. Why, isn't that enough for a whole lifetime?" -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Besides, nowadays, almost all capable people are terribly afraid of being ridiculous, and are miserable because of it." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoyevsky
item.description: "When reason fails, the devil helps!" -- Fyodor Dostoyevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by F. Dostoevskij
item.description: "We are all happy if we but knew it." -- F. Dostoevskij

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoyevsky
item.description: "Drowning men, it is said, cling to wisps of straw." -- Fyodor Dostoyevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "The fear of appearances is the first symptom of impotence." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "In every idea of genius or in every new human idea, or, more simply still, in every serious human idea born in anyone's brain, there is something that cannot possibly be conveyed to others." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoyevsky
item.description: "Lying is a delightful thing for it leads to the truth." -- Fyodor Dostoyevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Destroy my desires, eradicate my ideals, show me something better, and I will follow you." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "You must accept it as it is, and hence accept all consequences. A wall is indeed a wall." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Every ant Â knows the Â formula of its ant-hill, every Â bee knows Â the formula Â of its Â beehive. They know it Â in their own way, not in our way. Only humankind does not know its own formula." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "...it all, maybe, most likely, indeed, might turn out for the best." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "A real gentleman, even if he loses everything he owns, must show no emotion. Money must be so far beneath a gentleman that it is hardly worth troubling about." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Oday add a quote by Dostoyevsky
item.description: "With old liars who have been acting all their lives there are moments when they enter so completely into their part that they tremble or shed tears in earnest, although at that very moment, or a second later, they are able to whisper to themselves, "You know you are lying, you shameless old sinner! You're acting now, in spite of your 'holy' wrath." -- Dostoyevsky
